item.title: Help asap!
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

No like this

[code=Java]case 9167:
if(c.teleEffect == 1)
c.triggerTele(2907, 9714, 0);
if(c.teleEffect == 1)
c.triggerTele(3020+misc.random(2), 4815+misc.random(2), 0);

if(c.teleEffect == 2)
	c.triggerTele(3233, 9313, 0);
break;

case 9168:
if(c.teleEffect == 1)
c.triggerTele(3244, 3518, 0);
if(c.teleEffect == 2)
c.triggerTele(3896, 6666, 0);
c.closeInterface();
break;
case 9169:
if(c.teleEffect == 1)
c.triggerTele(2539+misc.random(2), 4716+misc.random(2), 0);
if(c.teleEffect == 2)
c.triggerTele(2740, 5074, 0);
break;[/code]

item.title: Help asap!
item.dc:creator: @owwch_u_died owwch u died
item.description:
@owwch_u_died wrote:

All i am trying to do is change my teleport to a 3 way teleport… i shouldnt need all that. ok, wat does it mean when i get a compiling error saying “unreachable statement”??? when i have them all at tele effect 2…

case 9167:
if(c.teleEffect == 1)
c.triggerTele(2907, 9714, 0);
if(c.teleEffect == 1)
c.triggerTele(3020+misc.random(2), 4815+misc.random(2), 0);
break;
if(c.teleEffect == 2)
c.triggerTele(3233, 9313, 0);
case 9168:
if(c.teleEffect == 1)
c.triggerTele(3244, 3518, 0);
if(c.teleEffect == 2)
c.triggerTele(3896, 6666, 0);
c.closeInterface();
break;
case 9169:
if(c.teleEffect == 1)
c.triggerTele(2539+misc.random(2), 4716+misc.random(2), 0);
break;
if(c.teleEffect == 2)
c.triggerTele(2740, 5074, 0);
break;
The 2’s are my new ones i want to do… and i get an unreachable statement?

Read full topic

item.title: Help asap!
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

There’s no point in tele effect unless you mean stillgfx or gfx100

There is usually conditions for clicking a button. such as

if(isInTeleporterScreen()) { //teleport } else if(npcDialogue == 1) { //go to next dialogue } else if(questStageDSlayer == 3) { //advance quest }

Read full topic

item.title: Help asap!
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

Basically, what deathchaos said.

[code=java]case 1:
//First teleport
break;

case 2:
//second teleport
break;

case 3:
//third teleport
break;[/code]

Replace the cases with what you action buttons are for “A”, “B”, “C” or “Teleport 1”, “Teleport 2”, “Teleport 3”

Read full topic

item.title: Help asap!
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

First off, you need to know what the button Id you’re going to use is.
Once you have that paste this in ClickingMost

case [b]BUTTONID[/b]: c.teleEffect = [b]#[/b]; c.sendQuest("Title Of Interface", 2470); c.sendQuest("[b]A[/b]", 2471); c.sendQuest("[b]B[/b]", 2472); c.sendQuest("[b]C[/b]", 2473); c.sendFrame164(2469); break;
[b]BUTTONID[/b] - Id of the button [b]#[/b] - See below [b]A[/b] - First Option [b]B[/b] - Second Option [b]C[/b] - Third Option

Than find case 9167:
Under it add

if (c.teleEffect == [b]#[/b]) { //Whatever you want to do...(For [b]A[/b] Only) }
[b]#[/b] - Tele effect number, whatever you want it to be as long as its not already defined (So don't use 1 or anything)

Do the same for case’s 9168(For B) and 9169(For C) and you’re good to go.

Read full topic

item.title: Help asap!
item.dc:creator: @owwch_u_died owwch u died
item.description:
@owwch_u_died wrote:

OK, well i have a 317 deltascape based source… and i need there to be a teleport that is similar to this.

case 50245: // Pk Teleport
c.teleEffect = 1;
c.sendQuest(“Which wild zone?”, 2470);
c.sendQuest(“Pk Box”, 2471);
c.sendQuest(“Varrock”, 2472);
c.sendQuest(“Mage bank”, 2473);
c.sendFrame164(2469);
break;
When you click it, it gives 3 options of where to go… but wwat do the numbers behind them mean…?? Im trying to make another one similar to this one, but Not sure wat numbers and etc i need. Please help!

Read full topic
